meanings.definition: The quality or state of being oracular.
meanings.sent1: Her oracularity was evident in the way she always seemed to know the right thing to say.
meanings.sent2: The oracularity of the ancient priestess was revered by all who sought her guidance.
meanings.sent3: The oracularity of the fortune teller made her the star of the town's annual fair.
meanings.sent4: His oracularity was like a beacon of light in the darkness of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The oracularity of the wise owl was unmatched in the enchanted forest.

meanings.definition: The ability to give wise and insightful advice or predictions.
meanings.sent1: People sought her out for her oracularity when faced with tough decisions.
meanings.sent2: The oracularity of the old sage was sought after by kings and commoners alike.
meanings.sent3: The oracularity of the weatherman was surprisingly accurate during the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her oracularity was like a crystal ball, revealing the hidden truths of the future.
meanings.sent5: The oracularity of the village elder was passed down through generations as a precious gift.
